intro: Bystropogon × schmitzii, commonly known as the Schmitz's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is native to South Africa. The plant has small, leathery leaves and produces white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its berries are red and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. This species is notable for its unique ecological role in supporting local wildlife and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
